Arad Fort

Overview:

Arad Fort is a historic Islamic fort in Bahrain that dates back to the 15th century. Known for its strategic coastal location, it showcases traditional Bahraini military architecture and has been meticulously restored.

Highlights:

  • Established in: 15th century
  • Main architectural feature: Four circular towers connected by thick walls and a central courtyard
  • Used for: Defense against Portuguese and Omani invasions

Location & Access:

Located in Arad near Muharraq, the fort is adjacent to Arad Bay and can be accessed by car or taxi. The surrounding walking paths and bay views make it a serene place for a visit.

Historical Background:

The fort was built using coral stones and palm trunks, showcasing traditional techniques. It played a significant role in Bahrain's military history and was later renovated by the Bahrain Authority for Culture and Antiquities.

Fun Facts:

  • Used as a filming location for cultural and historical documentaries.
  • It is illuminated at night, offering a magical view.
  • Hosts cultural events and festivals in its courtyard.

Visitor Tips:

  • Open daily, with extended hours on weekends.
  • Best visited in the late afternoon for sunset views over the bay.
  • Bring water and wear comfortable shoes for walking the grounds.

Explore the fort during cultural seasons to enjoy exhibitions and traditional music events.
